title: The Woman Who Sparked the Greatest Sex Scandal of All Time
description: Journalist Ishtar Benten is promoted to the most secret department of the News Agency that monopolizes information. Soon afterwards, her erotic-coffee colleague disappears mysteriously, and she starts a very dangerous investigation to find him.How would you act when Love conflicts with Truth? Which is the sexiest of all possible worlds? "The Woman Who Sparked the Greatest Sex Scandal of All Time" is a dystopian adventure like those of George Orwell, Aldous Huxley, Ray Bradbury, Anthony Burgess, and Philip K Dick. At the same time, it is a captivating and emotionally charged novel, and it offers readers high doses of passion, suspense, and mystery. It has been given "The Kirkus Star," a distinction that is "Awarded to Books of Exceptional Merit," and has been listed among the "Best Books of 2013" by Kirkus Reviews.The book is recommended for ages 16+. It contains unconventional descriptions of explicit sex, but it is not an adult-only novel. Check out the author's blog: denouncecensorship.blogspot.com
author: Eli Yaakunah
